verses.roman:
sukha-rūpa kṛṣṇa kare sukha āsvādana
bhakta-gaṇe sukha dite 'hlādinī'--kāraṇa

synonyms: sukha-rūpa—embodiment of pleasure; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; kare—does; sukha—happiness; āsvādana—tasting; bhakta-gaṇe—unto the devotees; sukha—happiness; dite—to give; hlādinī—the pleasure potency; kāraṇa—the cause.
translation: "Lord Kṛṣṇa tastes all kinds of transcendental happiness, although He Himself is happiness personified. The pleasure relished by His pure devotees is also manifest by His pleasure potency.
